column4: best part of 11.10.. native adaptec 6405 aacraid drives.. no more wasted time compiling that module for installs... yay!
are you talking about embedded adaptec driver in the kernel?
i mean i just installed the daily on one of my servers with that card in it and I didn't have to add steps for it to see the arrays. soo nice
i think there was the later end of the 2.x kernels that had support for it to. but not during install of 11.04 as it was 1 kernel version too old
cool. i work with raid cards in linux, but we uses debian
We are an Ubuntu shop.
i dont know if already there are support to that board in squeeze
and those cards used to give me hell
the problem is recompile the kernel to support it?
the problem was it was in a rpm from adaptec so during install you had to dkms and alien the package
at least in 11.04
do you sell hardware for ubuntu? what is your url shop?
we don't sell. shop meaning all our servers are ubuntu and our desktops are all ubuntu.
is common a rc before a final release in ubuntu releases>
ok :) do you use adaptec 2405?
no only the 6405
and alot of asus pike cards
pike cards? what it that?

a pike is like a manufacturer sas card for asus motherboards. it works like the adaptec. but it uses the motherboard sata connectors. and has a very special connector kinda like a really stretched out PCI
humm. i understood. Intel calls it a zero channel raid board (i guess). we already used that, but a lot time ago, witch scsi.
http://us.estore.asus.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=2049 thats a pike
thank you. i didnt about that
